snippet.title: Episode 005 Amber Prosia Interviewing Annette Densham
snippet.description:
Welcome to Episode #5 of The Parenting Biz Podcast - coming to you every single Monday. Now let's chat with this week's featured Guest, Annette Densham.

Annette Densham is a weaver of words, engaging storyteller, hoarder of knowledge, larrikin, mum, wife and lover of musicals… now working closely with entrepreneurs and innovators on raising their profile by tapping into the power of PR and social media.

This week, our entire interview will be captured around the board game, RISK.

This board game is one of careful planning, quick decisions and bold moves - just like our life, no matter which area of life you are focusing on, such as health, business, family, relationships, money or anything in between. 

We may feel like we’re either defending or attacking our enemies to protect our territory. 

So round up your troops, get into position and let the war begin! 

Or in the PR world; gather your content, choose your mode of communication and step foot on the battlefield by “Unleashing the PR Genie within!”

Here are some key points summarised in today’s battle:

- PR is everything you say and everything you do in your business including your personal accounts
- PR stands for Public Relations, however Annette, suggest you replace it for perception & relationships
- Relationship with media and your target audience
-PR isn’t a magic bullet - it’s a long term strategy

Getting & Placing New Armies:
- You MUST PLAN!
- Start with 90 days
- Each month, ask yourself, what is it that I need to be doing to expand my reach?
*Drop the bread crumbs
- Know exactly who your target audience is
- Then you can create some key messages
- What is it that you do?
- Why do you do it?
- How do you do it?
- What are people going to get out of working with you?
- What problems do you solve?
- When you are clear on this, it makes it easy to create content for your target audience
- Develop third party credibility (i.e be a guest on peoples Podcasts, speak at events, etc. 
- PR is earned media
- Advertising is something you pay for
- PR is ultimate word of mouth

Attacking:
- Bad PR is bad PR…
- Best way to handle negative PR is to PLAN
- Think of all the possible worse case scenarios and plan your response then when you are calm and not clustered
- Acknowledge the compliment and take it offline
- Bring empathy and compassion into how you deal with negativity
- Check in with yourself - why has that triggered me?
- What people think of you, has NOTHING to do with you
- There’s always 3 sides of the truth
- Surround yourself with REALLY good people
- Ask self, how can I improve this situation so it doesn’t happen again?
- What part are you playing in this?
- Empathise and be compassionate with bullies

Fortifying Your Position:
- Look after yourself
- Still must work on your business to grow your business
- Use your words to communicate with the important people in your lives - DON’T hold a grudge
- Start small - don’t over complicate it
- Set boundaries & expectations for clients from the beginning
- Tools:
Paypal, Gmail, Hootsuite (schedule all of your monthly content in a few hours a month), Google Calendar, Asana -(Project management tools), Slack (other ways to communicate), Xero & Canva
- The people around you: People to vent to, Mentor to guide you & Cheerleaders
- Use what you have 

Sets of Armies:
- Annette’s top 4 communication channels for PR:
1. Social Media: Facebook & Facebook Groups
2. Awards - Ultimate 3rd party credibility from Startups to well established business
3. Blogging - Content Creation
- Repurpose into all your other channels
4. Media
- In Australia there’s 9 to 10 THOUSAND different media outlets out there
Find 10 media outlets you’d like to be featured in (e.g Radio, TV, Magazines, Online Publications)
- Build relationship with journalists
- Repurpose & Leverage EVERYTHING
- Start with 4 blogs a month (Put aside 2-3 hours, 1x a month)
- Repurpose into 40 pieces of content
- Come up with 4 story ideas (e.g What are the problems you solve?
What should people know about you, that don’t? Share a case study)

Reflection - You’ve Won The Battle - This Time…
- Look after yourself
- If I don’t look after myself, everything else falls apart
- Stop giving yourself AND other people a hard time
- Manage expectations with clients, family and those in your inner circle from the start


Want to contact the guest? 
Email - hello@publicitygenie.com 








Music in Interview is:
BACK IN SUMMER by Nicolai Heidlas Music https://soundcloud.com/nicolai-heidlas
Creative Commons — Attribution 3.0 Unported— CC BY 3.0 
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/b...
Music promoted by Audio Library https://youtu.be/sGsC98vR4Q4
